fields.summary: Stopped instances using instance DNS show a dummy dns name

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Hi All, If one runs euca-describe-instances against a stopped EBS instance, one gets the following (this is with DNS enabled in the cloud); {code} $ euca-describe-instances i-CFE73FAE RESERVATION r-F9AC44AC 037261160869 default INSTANCE i-CFE73FAE emi-75DE3FB7 euca-.mycloud.jeevanullas.org euca-.mycloud.internal stopped sshlogin-new 0 m2.xlarge 2013-04-29T08:47:28.684Z cloud33 monitoring-disabled ebs BLOCKDEVICE /dev/sda vol-53593F9A 2013-04-29T08:47:28.845Z true BLOCKDEVICE /dev/vdb vol-5B193EC0 2013-04-29T11:43:38.659Z true {code} Check this out {code} public DNS name: euca-.mycloud.jeevanullas.org private DNS name: euca-.mycloud.internal {code} The same with --debug flag {code} $ euca-describe-instances i-CFE73FAE 2013-04-29 05:12:12,414 DEBUG DescribeInstances parsed arguments: {'userregion': None, 'filters': None, 'InstanceId': [], 'shell_configfile': '', 'deprecated_sec_key': None, 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'url': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None} 2013-04-29 05:12:12,417 INFO DescribeInstances parameters: {'Action': 'DescribeInstances', 'Version': '2013-02-01'} 2013-04-29 05:12:12,417 INFO Eucalyptus sending request (attempt 1 of 5) 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request method: POST 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request url: http://10.104.1.150:8773/services/Eucalyptus 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request header: Content-Length: 220 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request header: Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.0.0-alpha6-5-g2ebd16c (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-358.2.1.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.1.0-alpha9 requests/1.1.0 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: AWSAccessKeyId: OFK8DOIG2E5P1QTSYBGP5 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Action: DescribeInstances 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Signature: ENyJ5DTs+3iG3MbfOOYOJa6386SY4waQ3NpkDHFVmP4= 2013-04-29 05:12:12,426 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: SignatureMethod: HmacSHA256 2013-04-29 05:12:12,427 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: SignatureVersion: 2 2013-04-29 05:12:12,427 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Timestamp: 2013-04-29T12:12:12Z 2013-04-29 05:12:12,427 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Version: 2013-02-01 2013-04-29 05:12:12,538 DEBUG Eucalyptus response time: 0.110 seconds 2013-04-29 05:12:12,538 INFO Eucalyptus response status: 200 2013-04-29 05:12:12,538 DEBUG Eucalyptus response header: content-length: 1510 2013-04-29 05:12:12,538 DEBUG Eucalyptus response header: content-type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8 2013-04-29 05:12:12,538 DEBUG DescribeInstances -- response content -- r-F9AC44AC037261160869defaulti-CFE73FAEemi-75DE3FB780stoppedeuca-.mycloud.internaleuca-.mycloud.jeevanullas.orgUSER_STOPPED: User stopped. -- []sshlogin-new0m2.xlarge2013-04-29T08:47:28.684Zcloud33disabledebs/dev/sda/dev/sdavol-53593F9Aattached2013-04-29T08:47:28.845Ztrueunknown,requested:/dev/vdbvol-5B193EC0attached2013-04-29T11:53:27.246Ztrue 2013-04-29 05:12:12,539 DEBUG DescribeInstances -- end of response content -- RESERVATION r-F9AC44AC 037261160869 default INSTANCE i-CFE73FAE emi-75DE3FB7 euca-.mycloud.jeevanullas.org euca-.mycloud.internal stopped sshlogin-new 0 m2.xlarge 2013-04-29T08:47:28.684Z cloud33 monitoring-disabled ebs BLOCKDEVICE /dev/sda vol-53593F9A 2013-04-29T08:47:28.845Z true BLOCKDEVICE unknown,requested:/dev/vdb vol-5B193EC0 2013-04-29T11:53:27.246Z true {code} Now we run the same on a stopped instance in EC2, the output is following {code} $ euca-describe-instances i-d69c69b8 RESERVATION r-1498f569 048212016277 sg-a69265cd INSTANCE i-d69c69b8 ami-5675ee3f stopped jeevanullas 0 t1.micro 2013-04-08T05:14:28.000Z us-east-1c aki-b6aa75df monitoring-disabled ebs paravirtual xen XKdLB1365267179357 sg-a69265cd default false BLOCKDEVICE /dev/sda1 vol-543a0412 2013-04-06T16:53:04.000Z true TAG instance i-d69c69b8 Name {code} Note the public DNS name and private DNS name are not present at all. The result of the same command as above, now with --debug {code} $ euca-describe-instances i-d69c69b8 --debug 2013-04-29 17:43:34,257 DEBUG DescribeInstances parsed arguments: {'userregion': None, 'filters': None, 'InstanceId': ['i-d69c69b8'], 'shell_configfile': '', 'deprecated_sec_key': None, 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'url': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': Eucalyptus request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.0.0-alpha6 (CPython 2.7.2; Darwin 12.3.0; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.1.0-alpha9 requests/1.2.0 2013-04-29 17:43:34,270 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: AWSAccessKeyId: OFK8DOIG2E5P1QTSYBGP5 2013-04-29 17:43:34,270 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Action: DescribeInstances 2013-04-29 17:43:34,270 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: InstanceId.1: i-d69c69b8 2013-04-29 17:43:34,270 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Signature: ENyJ5DTs+3iG3MbfOOYOJa6386SY4waQ3NpkDHFVmP4= 2013-04-29 17:43:34,270 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: SignatureMethod: HmacSHA256 2013-04-29 17:43:34,270 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: SignatureVersion: 2 2013-04-29 17:43:34,270 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Timestamp: 2013-04-29T12:13:34Z 2013-04-29 17:43:34,270 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Version: 2013-02-01 2013-04-29 17:43:37,379 DEBUG Eucalyptus response time: 3.108 seconds 2013-04-29 17:43:37,379 INFO Eucalyptus response status: 200 2013-04-29 17:43:37,379 DEBUG Eucalyptus response header: content-type: text/xml;charset=UTF-8 2013-04-29 17:43:37,379 DEBUG Eucalyptus response header: date: Mon, 29 Apr 2013 12:13:37 GMT 2013-04-29 17:43:37,379 DEBUG Eucalyptus response header: server: AmazonEC2 2013-04-29 17:43:37,379 DEBUG Eucalyptus response header: transfer-encoding: chunked 2013-04-29 17:43:37,379 DEBUG DescribeInstances -- response content -- b694cc00-fe24-4834-ba1d-ac783db6a278 r-1498f569 048212016277 sg-a69265cd jeevanullas i-d69c69b8 ami-5675ee3f 80 stopped User initiated (2013-04-08 05:15:39 GMT) jeevanullas 0 t1.micro 2013-04-08T05:14:28.000Z us-east-1c default aki-b6aa75df disabled sg-a69265cd jeevanullas Client.UserInitiatedShutdown Client.UserInitiatedShutdown: User initiated shutdown i386 ebs /dev/sda1 /dev/sda1 vol-543a0412 attached 2013-04-06T16:53:04.000Z true paravirtual XKdLB1365267179357 Name xen false 2013-04-29 17:43:37,381 DEBUG DescribeInstances -- end of response content -- RESERVATION r-1498f569 048212016277 sg-a69265cd INSTANCE i-d69c69b8 ami-5675ee3f stopped jeevanullas 0 t1.micro 2013-04-08T05:14:28.000Z us-east-1c aki-b6aa75df monitoring-disabled ebs paravirtual xen XKdLB1365267179357 sg-a69265cd default false BLOCKDEVICE /dev/sda1 vol-543a0412 2013-04-06T16:53:04.000Z true TAG instance i-d69c69b8 Name {code} CLC should make its behaviour inline with EC2. Please let me know if there are any questions. Cheers! Deependra
fields.summary: stopped instances show invalid value for public private DNS names

comments.body: [~dshekhawat] Please take a look at EUCA-2184. AWS does not show the public ip/dns in the stopped state. The fix for this seems to be to undo the fix for EUCA-2184 . What is the desired behavior here and is it compatible with AWS?
[~mmunn1], the desired behaviour is that we do not show the invalid values (so are compatible with AWS/EC2)
[~sjones] That is the current behavior since EUCA-2184.
[~mmunn1], IP addresses are separate from DNS names, this issue is for DNS names.
Ahh,  I see we are talking about the "euca-.mycloud.jeevanullas.org"    and 	"euca-.mycloud.internal"

Code Review Request : EUCA-5959 stopped instances show invalid value for public private DNS names

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-5959

diff :  git show --color c0e7071e98007574110bb47eb1ac1df0031481e9

Summary: In the "STOPPED" state the public and private DNS names were not getting set to an empty string
like the public and private IP's

Solution: If both the public and private IP's are empty strings then the instance is in the "STOPPED" state
so we set the public and private dns names to an empty string as well

unit test:
1) set PROPERTY bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns=true
2) start and then stop and ebs instance
3) run euca-describe-instances on the stopped instance
4) the public and private dns names should not appear at all.

I have created testcase ./eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/3-4/Euca5959

Thx Mike
Thanks for your help with this [~mmunn1]

No issues found. Ran the following: {code} [root@b-40 ~]# euca-describe-instances RESERVATION r-CCC64080 964651612507 default INSTANCE i-8BAC40E1 emi-EAB33E41 euca-10-111-103-0.eucalyptus.b-40.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com euca-1-119-224-93.eucalyptus.internal running clc 0 m1.small 2013-11-26T00:37:36.984Z PARTI00 monitoring-disabled 10.111.103.0 1.119.224.93 ebs hvm BLOCKDEVICE /dev/sda vol-BA903D19 2013-11-26T00:37:37.145Z true TAG instance i-8BAC40E1 euca:node 10.111.5.91 [root@b-40 ~]# euca-stop-instances i-8BAC40E1 INSTANCE i-8BAC40E1 running stopping r-CCC64080964651612507sg-49ED4023defaulti-8BAC40E1emi-EAB33E4180stoppedUSER_STOPPED: User stopped. -- []clc0m1.small2013-11-26T00:37:36.984ZPARTI00disabledebs/dev/sda/dev/sdavol-BA903D19attached2013-11-26T00:37:37.145Ztruehvmeuca:node10.111.5.91 2013-11-25 16:44:33,324 DEBUG DescribeInstances -- end of response content -- RESERVATION r-CCC64080 964651612507 default INSTANCE i-8BAC40E1 emi-EAB33E41 stopped clc 0 m1.small 2013-11-26T00:37:36.984Z PARTI00 monitoring-disabled ebs hvm BLOCKDEVICE /dev/sda vol-BA903D19 2013-11-26T00:37:37.145Z true TAG instance i-8BAC40E1 euca:node 10.111.5.91 [root@b-40 ~]# {code}
